body_html: Is there anyway to mask the padding 0s then, I use to do it before embedding but it made my autoencoder lazy (obviously). I've heard that embedding twice with the second time with idx set to some 0 mask worked. Anybody heard of that?
body_text: Is there anyway to mask the padding 0s then, I use to do it before embedding but it made my autoencoder lazy (obviously). I've heard that embedding twice with the second time with idx set to some 0 mask worked. Anybody heard of that?
body: Is there anyway to mask the padding 0s then, I use to do it before embedding but it made my autoencoder lazy (obviously). I've heard that embedding twice with the second time with idx set to some 0 mask worked. Anybody heard of that?
